data.enText: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy weights, do hard physical work, etc.
She wasn't a strong swimmer (= she could not swim well) .

data.chText: 他力气大得能抬起一辆汽车！
data.enText: He's strong enough to lift a car!

before.enText: of a natural or physical force

data.chText: 中午阳光最强的时候待在室内。
data.enText: Stay indoors in the middle of the day, when the sun is strongest.
having a powerful effect on the body or mind

data.chText: 有权势的；有影响的；有实力的
data.enText: having a lot of power or influence

data.chText: 重权在握的领导人；强有力的政府
有钱人；有势者；强势群体
data.enText: people who are rich or powerful

data.chText: 难以抵抗 / 击败 / 攻击

data.enText: very powerful and difficult for people to fight against or defeat

data.chText: 非常想把一切全都告诉她。
data.enText: The temptation to tell her everything was very strong.

data.chText: 有充分的证据证明锻炼有益于心脏健康。
data.enText: There is strong evidence of a link between exercise and a healthy heart.

data.chText: 你有充分的理由要求恢复你的工作。
data.enText: You have a strong case for getting your job back.

data.chText: 坚决的；坚定的；不动摇的；始终不渝的
data.enText: holding an opinion or a belief very firmly and seriously

data.chText: 坚决拥护 / 反对政府的人
data.enText: a strong supporter/opponent of the government

before.enText: of an opinion, a belief or a feeling

data.chText: 人们对这个问题反应强烈。
data.enText: People have strong feelings about this issue.
not easily broken or damaged; made well

data.chText: 坚强的；不易受惊吓的；有主见的
data.enText: not easily upset or frightened; not easily influenced by other people

data.chText: 在伦敦骑自行车，你可得有胆量。
data.enText: You need strong nerves to ride a bike in London.

data.chText: 我知道这不容易。不过要坚强！
data.enText: It's difficult, I know. But be strong!

data.chText: 有望成功的；可能性大的
有望获得这份工作的人选
data.enText: a strong candidate for the job

data.chText: 你们很有希望通过谈判达成协议。
data.enText: You're in a strong position to negotiate a deal.

data.chText: 我们很有可能会输掉比赛。
data.enText: There's a strong possibility that we'll lose the game.
The play has a very strong cast.

data.chText: 数学从来不是我的强项。
data.enText: Mathematics was never my strong point (= I was never very good at it) .

data.chText: 示威现场有了大批警察。
data.enText: There was a strong police presence at the demonstration.

data.chText: （用于数字后，表示某集体的规模）多达…的，计有…的
data.enText: used after numbers to show the size of a group

data.chText: 健康的；强壮的；身体好的
data.enText: not easily affected by disease; healthy

data.chText: 休息过后，你是不是感觉好些了？
data.enText: Are you feeling stronger now after your rest?

data.chText: 这所学院同当地产业界有牢固的联系。
data.enText: The college has strong links with local industry.

data.chText: 坚挺的；行情看涨的；呈强势的
data.enText: having a value that is high or increasing

data.chText: 欧元对美元呈强势走向。
data.enText: The euro is getting stronger against the dollar.

data.chText: 经营状况良好的；景气的

before.enText: of a business or an industry

data.chText: 尽管出现经济衰退，他们的酒席承办业仍然景气。
data.enText: Their catering business remained strong despite the recession.

data.chText: 易于看 / 听 / 感觉 / 嗅到
醒目的；响亮的；明显感觉得到的；浓烈的；强烈的
data.enText: easy to see, hear, feel or smell; very great or intense
a face with strong features (= large and noticeable)

data.chText: 她说话带有浓重的澳大利亚口音。
data.enText: She spoke with a strong Australian accent.

data.chText: 他承受着要辞职的巨大压力。
data.enText: He was under strong pressure to resign.
containing a lot of a substance
having a lot of force, often causing offence to people

data.chText: 这部电影因有脏话而受到批评。
data.enText: The movie has been criticized for strong language (= swearing) .

data.chText: 强变化的（通过改变元音而不是加规则的词尾来构成动词过去式和过去分词，如sing、sang）
data.enText: forming the past tense and past participle by changing a vowel, not by adding a regular ending, for example sing , sang

data.chText: 强读式的，重读的（某些词重读时的读音，如and的强式读音为 /ænd/ ）
data.enText: used to describe the way some words are pronounced when they have stress. For example, the strong form of and is /ænd/ .
He was strongly opposed to the idea.

data.chText: 这个问题我坚持自己的看法。
data.enText: This is an issue I feel strongly about (= I have firm opinions about) .

data.chText: 那个房间里散发着浓浓的上光剂的气味。
data.enText: The room smelt strongly of polish.

data.chText: （认为某人的话有失公允或过于苛刻时说）有点言重了
data.enText: used to say that you think what sb has said is unfair or too critical
I'm not very strong on dates (= I can't remember the dates of important events) .

data.chText: 某事物有很多；强于某一方面
data.enText: to have a lot of sth

data.chText: 这份报告批评的话说得多，但可行的建议提得少。
data.enText: The report was strong on criticism, but short on practical suggestions.
to be a subject that sb knows a lot about

data.chText: 恐怕地理不是我的强项。
data.enText: I'm afraid geography is not my strong suit.

data.chText: 言行过分；（尤指）露骨地调情
data.enText: to make your feelings clear in an aggressive way, especially your sexual feelings towards sb

data.chText: 保持健康；活跃依旧；兴盛不衰
data.enText: to continue to be healthy, active or successful
My grandmother is 90 and still going strong.
to be able to see or do unpleasant things without feeling sick or upset

data.chText: 某人的王牌；最强有力的一招；制胜的绝招
data.enText: something that gives sb an advantage over other people in a particular situation

data.text: well ♦ all right ♦ OK ♦ fine ♦ healthy ♦ strong ♦ fit

data.chText: 以上各词均形容人健康、身体好。
data.enText: These words all describe sb who is not ill and is in good health.
[not usually before noun] ( rather informal ) in good health

data.chText: 他身体怎么样，能够旅行吗？
data.enText: Is he well enough to travel?

data.chText: well尤用以谈自己的健康、询问别人的健康或评价身体情况。
data.enText: Well is used especially to talk about your own health, to ask sb about their health or to make a comment on it.

data.chText: 指感觉身体还好、没有生病、没有受伤：
data.enText: [not before noun] ( rather informal ) not feeling ill; not injured

data.chText: 指感觉身体还好、没有生病、没有受伤：
data.enText: [not before noun] ( informal ) not feeling ill; not injured

data.chText: 她说她现在身体还可以，明天就回来上班。
data.enText: She says she's OK now, and will be back at work tomorrow.

data.chText: 上述两词比同组其他词的肯定含意稍弱一些，两词均用于英语口语中，指没有生病、安然无恙，而非确定身体健康；两词均相当非正式，不过OK较all right还要非正式些。
data.enText: These words are slightly less positive than the other words in this group. They are both used in spoken English to talk about not actually being ill or injured, rather than being positively in good health. Both are rather informal but OK is slightly more informal than all right .

data.chText: （不用于否定句）指身体很好、健康：
data.enText: [not before noun] (not used in negative statements) ( rather informal ) completely well

data.chText: fine尤用于回应别人的询问，表示自己身体很健康；与人谈话时，亦可用以指另一人身体健康。与well不一样，fine通常不用于询问别人的身体状况或者谈论身体情况：
data.enText: Fine is used especially to talk about your health, especially when sb asks you how you are. It is also used to talk about sb's health when you are talking to sb else. Unlike well it is not often used to ask sb about their health or make a comment on it.
in good health and not likely to become ill
in good health and not suffering from an illness

data.chText: 几周之后她感觉好些了。
data.enText: After a few weeks she was feeling stronger.

data.chText: strong常用以指病后恢复健康。
data.enText: Strong is often used to talk about becoming healthy again after an illness.

data.chText: 指健壮，尤指因经常锻炼而身体健康：
data.enText: ( especially BrE ) in good physical health, especially because you take regular physical exercise

data.chText: 我每天游泳以保持健康。
data.enText: I go swimming every day in order to keep fit.

ex.chText: 他们需要几个足够强壮的人来干这个活儿。
ex.enText: They need several men strong enough to do the work.
Strong animals prey upon weaker ones.

ex.chText: 他将一条结实的绳子系在雪橇上。
ex.enText: He attached a strong rope to his sled.

ex.chText: 这些货物须用结实的木箱包装。
ex.enText: The goods are to be packed in strong wooden cases.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指人、动植物健壮有力的，或指物体坚固结实的。

ex.chText: 那个壮实的小伙子没费多大劲儿便把石块搬开了。
ex.enText: The sturdy young man removed the rock without much effort.

ex.chText: 小孩子需要结实的衣服。
赫克是一个为种族平等而战的坚强战士。
ex.enText: Huck was a sturdy fighter for racial equality.

synonyms.bx: 常指体魄强健的或构造牢固的，也指意志坚定、不轻易动摇的。

data.chText: （认为某人的话有失公允或过于苛刻时说）有点言重了
data.enText: used to say that you think what sb has said is unfair or too critical
I'm not very strong on dates (= I can't remember the dates of important events) .

data.chText: 某事物有很多；强于某一方面
data.enText: to have a lot of sth

data.chText: 这份报告批评的话说得多，但可行的建议提得少。
data.enText: The report was strong on criticism, but short on practical suggestions.
to be a subject that sb knows a lot about

data.chText: 恐怕地理不是我的强项。
data.enText: I'm afraid geography is not my strong suit.

data.chText: 言行过分；（尤指）露骨地调情
data.enText: to make your feelings clear in an aggressive way, especially your sexual feelings towards sb

data.chText: 保持健康；活跃依旧；兴盛不衰
data.enText: to continue to be healthy, active or successful
My grandmother is 90 and still going strong.
to be able to see or do unpleasant things without feeling sick or upset

data.chText: 某人的王牌；最强有力的一招；制胜的绝招
data.enText: something that gives sb an advantage over other people in a particular situation

example: gave a strong pull on the rope
a strong odor of burning rubber

tr: having a strong physiological or chemical effect
example: a potent cup of tea", "a stiff drink

tr: having or wielding force or authority
example: providing the ground soldier with increasingly potent weapons

tr: of verbs not having standard (or regular) inflection
having strength or power greater than average or expected

example: fortifications that made the frontier inviolable

value.def: Someone who is strong is healthy with good muscles and can move or carry heavy things, or do hard physical work.

example.ex: I'm not strong enough to carry him...
example.tran: 我力气不够大，抱不动他。

example.ex: I feared I wouldn't be able to control such a strong horse.
example.tran: 我怕我驾驭不了这么强壮的马。

value.tran: 强壮的;健壮的;力气大的

value.def: Someone who is strong is confident and determined, and is not easily influenced or worried by other people.

example.ex: He is sharp and manipulative with a strong personality...
example.tran: 他个性很强，为人精明且爱指使人。

example.ex: It's up to managers to be strong and do what they believe is right...
example.tran: 经理人应坚定立场，认准的事情就应该勇敢去做。

example.ex: Eventually I felt strong enough to look at him.
example.tran: 最后我才鼓起勇气向他看去。

value.tran: (人)坚定的，坚决的，自信的

value.def: Strong objects or materials are not easily broken and can support a lot of weight or resist a lot of strain.

example.ex: The vacuum flask has a strong casing, which won't crack or chip...
example.tran: 这种热水瓶瓶身坚固，不易断裂破碎。

example.ex: Glue the mirror in with a strong adhesive...
example.tran: 用强力胶把镜子牢牢地粘上。

example.ex: The fabric is strong enough to withstand harsh processing.
example.tran: 这种织物非常结实，能经受粗加工。

value.tran: 不易损坏的;坚固的;结实的

example.ex: The fence was very strongly built, with very large posts.
example.tran: 围栏用粗大的木桩建成，非常坚固。

value.def: A strong wind, current, or other force has a lot of power or speed, and can cause heavy things to move.

example.ex: Strong winds and torrential rain combined to make conditions terrible for golfers in the Scottish Open...
example.tran: 狂风暴雨一齐袭来，致使苏格兰高尔夫球公开赛的比赛条件变得异常糟糕。

example.ex: A fairly strong current seemed to be moving the whole boat...
example.tran: 一股湍急的水流好像要冲走整条船。

example.ex: A neutron star has a gravitational field strong enough to generate X-rays.
example.tran: 中子星上存在强大的重力场，足以产生X射线。

value.tran: (风、水流等)强劲的，迅猛的，狂奔的

example.ex: The metal is strongly attracted to the surface.
example.tran: 金属紧紧地吸附在表面上。

value.def: A strong impression or influence has a great effect on someone.

example.ex: We're glad if our music makes a strong impression, even if it's a negative one...
example.tran: 如果我们的音乐能给人留下深刻的印象，哪怕是负面的印象，我们都会很高兴。

example.ex: There will be a strong incentive to enter into a process of negotiation...
example.tran: 将会出现迫切地想要进入谈判阶段的强烈动机。

example.ex: Teenage idols have a strong influence on our children...
example.tran: 青少年偶像对孩子们的影响非常深。

example.ex: We had strong family traditions; we couldn't escape them.
example.tran: 我们有浓厚的家族传统，我们无法逃避。

value.tran: (印象、影响)强烈的，深刻的

example.ex: He is strongly influenced by Spanish painters such as Goya and El Greco...
example.tran: 他深受戈雅、埃尔·格列柯等西班牙画家的影响。

example.ex: They were so determined to learn and they were so strongly motivated.
example.tran: 他们深受激励，决心好好学习。

value.def: If you have strong opinions on something or express them using strong words, you have extreme or very definite opinions which you are willing to express or defend.

example.ex: She is known to hold strong views on Cuba...
example.tran: 她在古巴问题上的鲜明观点人人皆知。

example.ex: There has been strong criticism of the military regime...
example.tran: 该军事政权一直受到人们的强烈抨击。

example.ex: I am a strong supporter of the NHS...
example.tran: 我是国民医疗保健制度的坚定支持者。

example.ex: It condemned in extremely strong language what it called Britain's iniquitous campaign...
example.tran: 它言辞激烈地谴责了这场它所谓的英国极不公正的竞选活动。

example.ex: It's bad judgment, but it's not treason. I think treason is too strong a word.
example.tran: 这是一次判断失误，但不是叛国。我认为说叛国太过了。

value.tran: (观点、措辞)坚定的，强烈的，不动摇的

example.ex: Obviously you feel very strongly about this...
example.tran: 显然你对这件事的看法很坚定。

example.ex: We are strongly opposed to the presence of America in this region...
example.tran: 我们强烈反对美国势力介入这一区域。

example.ex: The police have strongly criticised England's football authorities...
example.tran: 警方强烈谴责了英格兰足球管理机构。

example.ex: The presidents issued a strongly-worded statement in support of the government.
example.tran: 诸位总统联合发表了一份措辞鲜明的声明来支持该政府。

value.def: If someone in authority takes strong action, they act firmly and severely.

example.ex: The government has said it will take strong action against any further strikes...
example.tran: 政府声称要采取严厉行动制止罢工进一步发展。

example.ex: He has also said he will have to become a strong President to put things right.
example.tran: 他还说为力挽狂澜他将不得不做一个强权总统。

value.tran: (当权者的行为)坚定的，强硬的，严厉的，不动摇的

value.def: If there is a strong case or argument for something, it is supported by a lot of evidence.

example.ex: The testimony presented offered a strong case for acquitting her on grounds of self-defense...
example.tran: 当庭的证词为裁定她是正当防卫而无罪提供了强有力的证据。

example.ex: The evidence that such investment promotes growth is strong...
example.tran: 有充分的证据表明这种投资能够促进增长。

example.ex: A strong link was found between parental mental illness and disturbance in their children.
example.tran: 业已发现父母的精神病史和子女的精神障碍之间有密切的关系。

value.tran: (理由、论据)有说服力的，强有力的，充分的

example.ex: He argues strongly for retention of NATO as a guarantee of peace...
example.tran: 他强烈要求保留北大西洋公约组织以维护和平。

example.ex: These are conditions said by doctors to be strongly indicative of heart failure.
example.tran: 这些症状都是医生们说的心力衰竭的明显前兆。

value.def: If there is a strong possibility or chance that something is true or will happen, it is very likely to be true or to happen.

example.ex: There is a strong possibility that the cat contracted the condition by eating contaminated pet food.
example.tran: 猫很有可能是吃了受污染的宠物食品而染上这种疾病的。

value.tran: (可能性、机会)极大的

value.def: Your strong points are your best qualities or talents, or the things you are good at.

example.ex: Discretion is not Jeremy's strong point...
example.tran: 小心谨慎不是杰里米的强项。

example.ex: Exports may be the only strong point in the economy over the next six to 12 months...
example.tran: 在接下来的 6 到 12 个月中，出口也许是经济中的唯一亮点。

example.ex: Even in the area of foreign policy, his strong suit, he failed to deliver a major foreign policy address...
example.tran: 即使在他擅长的外交政策领域里，他也没能发表过一个重要的外交政策演讲。

example.ex: Cynics argue that the EU is stronger on rhetoric than on concrete action.
example.tran: 怀疑者认为，相比具体行动，欧盟更擅长夸夸而谈。

value.tran: 优秀的;精通的;擅长的

value.def: A strong competitor, candidate, or team is good or likely to succeed.

example.ex: She was a strong contender for Britain's Olympic team...
example.tran: 她是有望入选英国奥运代表团的有力竞争者。

example.ex: Some countries where English is becoming a strong competitor to French, such as Algeria and Senegal, may see an immediate halt to the council's work...
example.tran: 在一些国家里，比如阿尔及利亚和塞内加尔，英语正在成为法语强有力的竞争者，委员会在这些地方的工作可能会很快陷入停滞状态。

example.ex: They've got a strong squad and some great players...
example.tran: 他们有一支实力雄厚的队伍和一些出色的选手。

example.ex: This show has several strengths — notably a strong cast.
example.tran: 这个表演有一些亮点——尤其是演员阵容特别强大。

value.tran: (竞争者、候选人、队伍)强大的，有望成功的，有实力的

value.def: If a relationship or link is strong, it is close and likely to last for a long time.

example.ex: He felt he had a relationship strong enough to talk frankly to Sarah...
example.tran: 他认为和萨拉的关系很紧密，足以推心置腹。

example.ex: This has tested our marriage, and we have come through it stronger than ever...
example.tran: 这是对我们婚姻的考验，我们经受住了考验而且关系比以往任何时候都更稳固了。

example.ex: Delhi first began to develop strong ties with Moscow in the 1950s.
example.tran: 德里在 20 世纪 50 年代开始和莫斯科建立起稳固的关系。

value.tran: (关系)稳固的，持久的，牢固的

value.def: A strong currency, economy, or industry has a high value or is very successful.

example.ex: The US dollar continued its strong performance in Tokyo today...
example.tran: 美元今天在东京继续保持强劲的走势。

example.ex: The local economy is strong and the population is growing...
example.tran: 当地经济蓬勃发展，人口也在增长。

example.ex: The company was not financially strong enough to be floated on the Stock Exchange.
example.tran: 该公司资金不够雄厚，无法上市。

value.tran: (货币)坚挺的;(经济)强劲的;(行业)景气的

value.def: If something is a strong element or part of something else, it is an important or large part of it.

example.ex: We are especially encouraged by the strong representation, this year, of women in information technology disciplines...
example.tran: 今年，女性在信息技术领域的突出表现尤其让我们备受鼓舞。

example.ex: There is a strong element of truth to each of these explanations.
example.tran: 这些解释每一个都很有道理。

value.tran: (因素、成分)重要的，占很大比例的

value.def: You can use strong when you are saying how many people there are in a group. For example, if a group is twenty strong, there are twenty people in it.

example.ex: Ukraine indicated that it would establish its own army, 400,000 strong.
example.tran: 乌克兰表示将自己建立一支40 多万人的军队。

example.ex: ...a 1,000-strong crowd.
example.tran: 有 1,000 多人的人群

value.tran: 大量的;众多的;多达…的

value.def: A strong drink, chemical, or drug contains a lot of the particular substance which makes it effective.

example.ex: Strong coffee or tea late at night may cause sleeplessness...
example.tran: 深夜喝浓咖啡或浓茶可能会导致失眠。

example.ex: In strong concentrations it can cause nausea and vomiting.
example.tran: 浓度过高会导致恶心呕吐。

value.tran: (饮品、化学品、药物)含量高的，浓的，酽的

value.def: A strong colour, flavour, smell, sound, or light is intense and easily noticed.

example.ex: As she went past there was a gust of strong perfume...
example.tran: 她走过时有一股浓烈的香水味。

example.ex: Strong colours would flatter her pale skin and dark hair...
example.tran: 亮颜色更能衬托她的白皮肤和黑头发。

example.ex: The wine goes with strong and mild cheese alike.
example.tran: 喝这酒的时候可以搭配浓乳酪或淡乳酪。

value.tran: 醒目的;响亮的;浓烈的;强烈的

example.ex: He leaned over her, smelling strongly of sweat...
example.tran: 他向她俯过身来，身上散发着浓浓的汗味。

example.ex: The effect only works well with strongly coloured subjects.
example.tran: 色彩鲜明的主题才会产生这种效果。

value.def: If someone has a strong accent, they speak in a distinctive way that shows very clearly what country or region they come from.

example.ex: 'Good, Mr Ryle,' he said in English with a strong French accent.
example.tran: “好的，赖尔先生，”他用带有浓重法国口音的英语说。

value.tran: (口音)浓重的

value.def: You can say that someone has strong features or a strong face if their face has large, distinctive features.

example.ex: He had a strong Greek nose and olive-black eyes.
example.tran: 他有一个高挺的希腊式鼻子和一双墨橄榄绿色的眼睛。

value.tran: (面貌)轮廓分明的

value.def: If someone comes on strong, they make their intentions or feelings clear in an excessive or aggressive way.

example.ex: 'I come on strong sometimes. Don't know why.' She was beginning to feel like a bully.
example.tran: “我有时言行很过分，不知道为什么。”她开始感觉自己像个恶霸。

value.tran: 言行过分;情绪激烈

value.def: If someone or something is still going strong, they are still alive, in good condition, or popular after a long time.

example.ex: The old machinery was still going strong.
example.tran: 这台旧机器依然运转良好。

value.tran: 保持健康;依旧活跃;兴盛不衰

trans: 对…特别偏爱的，特别注重…的
很强的兴趣（或利益关系）
强劲增长；强劲的增长势头
强酸；强酸性；阳离子树脂；镪水
